title: Variability within species - laboratory exercise

author: Alenka Pokeržnik, Srednja ekonomska šola Maribor (SEŠ)

segmentation: Hello everybody, I'm a link of poker Nick.
I'm from secondary School of Economics in Maribor.
I'm biology teacher and I teach biology for 17 years.
Students of our school has biology.
Their first two years of education and the big part of studying biology are.
No.
Lab work and field work.
This way they can.
They can improve their theoretical knowledge.
During my career I have been using different ICT methods.
I have been introduced my students to blogging virtual classroom.
Used veterinary interfaces and so on.
So this year I decided to try flipped learning becausw.
I wanted to learn more about the method and of course in to introduce it into a learning process.
Uh.
While the students gain from the flip learning, they develop responsibility.
Certain degree of time management.
They can decide when.
And where they will watch it video, and in my case they can be better prepared for the lab work.
So as I said, I for this project I choose lab work.
What was the goals for the lesson?
Acquire knowledge on the topic of the variability within within species.
Recognize the differences between organisms.
And represent the data in the form of spreadsheets and the graph.
What do you want for the execution?
I use screencast O Matic.
This is really handy tool for recording screenshots.
I use PowerPoint presentation and.
Made approximately 2 minutes long video.
I just use option for recording my voice and I did not include my picture for the first time.
The second program was the app's action, which is a great tool and you can add some activities and interactive features to the video.
Approximately a week before.
Execution of the lab work.
I uploaded the video in the virtual classroom.
So which information was?
So why did I choose the lab work?
An important part of lab work is explaining the instructions.
However, usually we have a limited time.
The shed will only enable us to.
Use one or two lessons for the execution of the lab work and the great part of this time was spent on the instructions with the flipped learning.
I changed this part into a homework I made two minute long video and this video all also featured some activities that encourage students to think about the meaning of this lab work.
The key part of every lab work is also to determine the hypothesis when working as usually.
So when we are not flipped.
We determined the hypothesis together in the beginning of the lab work in the case of flipped learning, the students determine the hypothesis at home, independently from their classmates.
So which informations were given to the students in the video?
First, a bit of theory, then purpose of this lab work.
How are we gonna execute the work?
And as I already said.
The students had to determine their hypothesis based on the information in the video.
They also answered some theoretical questions.
Those are some printscreens from this video which includes.
Theory and this is also some theory.
They have to put the hypothesis here in this.
Place.
I plan to execute the this lab work in two classes of our first year students.
But I already encountered the first problem.
Students of one of the classes forgot to watch the video.
Forgot.
And consequently I unplanned Lee had a chance to compare the classical method with the flipped learning.
This is this action analysis where I could saw which students watched the video, which students didn't, and also I saw which answer did I answered.
So I have a complete review of all of the students homework.
Ha.
So that means in the class that were students didn't watch the video.
I had to explain all of the instructions in the beginning of the.
Lab work and we also determine hypothesis together that means that we didn't have enough time for analysis at the end, so they had to do the analysis at home, like as a homework.
So how did we carry out the lab work variability within species?
Is the foundation for the adopting for varying living conditions.
The students researched variability between different sizes of Walnut shells.
Different lengths of the Ivy leaves and seashells.
Each group of students was given 1010 examples of each of the listed things and then measure the length with the.
Ruler.
And they wrote the results into the spreadsheets.
From the acquired data we drew.
After the graph paper and we also drew one graph on the whiteboard together.
After finishing work, we analyze the results and we find out that the hypothesis that the students made account were correct.
One lesson was enough for finishing the work with the group that saw the video account, but not enough for the group that didn't watch the video.
So what is student said about the method the students encountered?
The method for the first time they found it enjoyable and useful.
Their favorite part, where the activities during the video.
However, they notified me that the videos shouldn't be longer than 5 minutes.
I I also have recordings of two students which didn't watch the video.
First one says that.

He's a really active sportsman and he really has no time and his time management is poor so he just didn't watch the other one forgot at first, but then he remembered and he thought that I wouldn't notice that he didn't watch 'cause he didn't know that I could see the progress in this action.
So.
Which weaknesses I have notice during my first attempt of flipped learning?
Free version of action only enables us to see first 5 answers with the others.
We only see the progress in watching the video and how many answer the answer is.
The pro version which is which we have to pay our extended but I don't have this version so we cannot be sure that the students will see the video in time which actually happened to me.
And I kind of dislike the idea of giving my students homework.
So maybe for final thought, using flip learning methods method is definitely interesting.
Addition to lessons.
It's the first step to encourage students to take responsibility for their education.
Thank you.
